summary: This document is a chain of emails from April 2019 between an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York and other parties, coordinating the upload of subpoenaed documents from the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner into the Relativity e-discovery platform for the case US v. Epstein (USAO #2018R01618). It details folder structures and specific files to include or exclude, referencing two productions from the law firm.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender/coordinator of the emails, instructing on the upload of subpoenaed documents from Boies Schiller Flexner into the Relativity system for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Boies Schiller first subpoena response
events.description: The law firm Boies Schiller Flexner produces documents in response to a subpoena from the SDNY investigation into Epstein.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Boies Schiller second subpoena response
events.description: Boies Schiller Flexner provides a follow-up production of documents in response to the SDNY subpoena.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Boies Schiller second subpoena response (follow-up)
events.description: Additional documents are received in the same production and are requested to be added to the Relativity platform.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The law firm Boies Schiller Flexner was subpoenaed and produced documents for the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case US v. Epstein, USAO #2018R01618).
The correspondence details the technical process of loading these subpoenaed documents into the e-discovery platform Relativity, including specific folder paths and files to exclude.

The emails reference video interview files (e.g., Interview H, Interview J, Interview S, Interview A) that appear to be on DVDs and are instructed not to be loaded into Relativity, indicating the existence of recorded witness interviews.
The document shows active evidence management by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in the Epstein case as of April 2019.
